question: The ratio of the magnitudes of electric field to the magnetic field of an electromagnetic wave is of the order of
explanation: For an electromagnetic wave in vacuum, the ratio of the amplitude of the electric field (<katex>$E_0$</katex>) to the magnetic field (<katex>$B_0$</katex>) is equal to the speed of light (<katex>$c$</katex>).
The order of magnitude is <katex>$10^8 ms^{-1}$</katex>.
